questions.question_text: What year did the SkyTrain Expo Line open to the public?
questions.explanation: The Expo Line opened in December 1985 in time for Expo '86.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain line opened in 2002?
questions.explanation: The Millennium Line opened in 2002 as the second SkyTrain line.

questions.question_text: Which line connects downtown Vancouver with Richmond and the airport?
questions.explanation: The Canada Line (opened in 2009) travels from downtown Vancouver to Richmond and YVR Airport.

questions.question_text: Which station connects directly to both SeaBus and West Coast Express?
questions.explanation: Waterfront Station links SkyTrain with the SeaBus and West Coast Express commuter rail.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain station sees the highest annual ridership?
questions.explanation: Commercial–Broadway is typically the busiest station (~11 million entries in 2024).

questions.question_text: Burrard Station was closed for most of 2023 for major upgrades.
questions.explanation: True. Burrard Station closed in February 2023 and reopened in early 2024 after elevator and escalator upgrades.

questions.question_text: Joyce–Collingwood Station was originally called just 'Joyce Station'.
questions.explanation: True. It was known as Joyce Station until being renamed in 2016 to include 'Collingwood'.

questions.question_text: Stadium–Chinatown Station always had 'Chinatown' in its name.
questions.explanation: False. It was just 'Stadium' until 2004, when 'Chinatown' was added.

questions.question_text: Commercial–Broadway Station was created by merging two separate stations.
questions.explanation: True. In 2009, Expo Line's Broadway Station and Millennium's Commercial Drive Station were merged into Commercial–Broadway.

questions.question_text: The new Capstan Station on the Canada Line was funded through developer contributions.
questions.explanation: True. Developers paid levies to fund Capstan Station, which opened in December 2024.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain station is the downtown terminal for both Expo and Canada Lines?
questions.explanation: Waterfront is the terminal station for both Expo and Canada Lines in downtown.

questions.question_text: What is the eastern terminus of the Expo Line (as of 2025)?
questions.explanation: King George Station in Surrey is the current Expo Line terminus until the Langley extension opens.

questions.question_text: Where is the Millennium Line's terminus on the northeast end?
questions.explanation: The Millennium Line ends at Lafarge Lake–Douglas Station in Coquitlam (since the Evergreen Extension opened).

questions.question_text: What is the terminal station of the Richmond branch of the Canada Line?
questions.explanation: Richmond–Brighouse is the southern terminus of the Richmond branch of the Canada Line.

questions.question_text: Match each SkyTrain station to its municipality: 1) Metrotown, 2) King George, 3) Richmond–Brighouse, 4) Lafarge Lake–Douglas
questions.explanation: Metrotown is in Burnaby; King George in Surrey; Richmond–Brighouse in Richmond; Lafarge Lake–Douglas in Coquitlam.

questions.question_text: Which two stations switched from Millennium Line service to Expo Line service in 2016?
questions.explanation: When the lines were reconfigured in 2016, Sapperton and Braid switched from Millennium to Expo Line service.

questions.question_text: Which station is directly connected to a major shopping mall?
questions.explanation: Metrotown Station is integrated with Metropolis at Metrotown shopping centre in Burnaby.

questions.question_text: Surrey Central Station is located near which landmarks?
options: SFU Surrey and Central City Mall
questions.correct_answer: SFU Surrey and Central City Mall
questions.explanation: Surrey Central is near Central City Mall (which houses SFU Surrey) and close to City Hall.

questions.question_text: Which station is a junction between Expo and Millennium Lines with cross-platform transfers?
questions.explanation: Commercial–Broadway is the main transfer point between Expo-Millennium (cross-platform).

questions.question_text: Which historic building houses Waterfront Station?
questions.explanation: Waterfront Station is the grand neoclassical CPR railway station from 1914.

questions.question_text: Why is the Expo Line called the 'Expo Line'?
options: Named after Expo Gardens in Burnaby
questions.explanation: It was built for Expo '86, so it was named the Expo Line to commemorate the event.

questions.question_text: The Millennium Line got its name because:
options: It's named after a BC politician
questions.explanation: It opened in 2002 (the new millennium), hence 'Millennium Line'.

questions.question_text: What was the Canada Line commonly called during planning?
questions.explanation: During planning it was the RAV Line (Richmond-Airport-Vancouver), but launched as 'Canada Line'.

questions.question_text: What track gauge do SkyTrain trains run on?
options: They use rubber wheels on concrete
questions.explanation: SkyTrain uses standard gauge track on all lines.

questions.question_text: What technology do Expo and Millennium Line trains use for propulsion?
questions.explanation: Expo/Millennium use LIM propulsion with power from the third rail.

questions.question_text: How are Canada Line trains powered?
questions.explanation: Canada Line uses conventional electric motors powered by 750V DC overhead wires.

questions.question_text: What is SkyTrain's maximum speed?
questions.explanation: SkyTrain trains reach approximately 80 km/h at full speed on straight sections.

questions.question_text: What train control system does SkyTrain use?
questions.explanation: SkyTrain uses the SelTrac communications-based moving-block system for automation.

questions.question_text: How are SkyTrain fares structured?
questions.explanation: TransLink uses fare zones: Vancouver is Zone 1; inner suburbs Zone 2; outer suburbs Zone 3.

questions.question_text: SkyTrain's on-time service delivery is approximately:
questions.explanation: BCRTC reports SkyTrain on-time performance around 96.5% in recent years.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain lines are operated by BCRTC (TransLink) directly?
questions.explanation: TransLink's BCRTC operates Expo and Millennium Lines, while Canada Line is operated by ProTrans BC.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain station has platform screen doors?
questions.explanation: Only YVR–Airport Station has platform screen doors (for airport safety and climate) - no other station does.

questions.question_text: Which municipalities have SkyTrain service?
options: Vancouver, Burnaby, New West, Richmond, Surrey, Coquitlam, Port Moody
questions.correct_answer: Vancouver, Burnaby, New West, Richmond, Surrey, Coquitlam, Port Moody
questions.explanation: SkyTrain's 54 stations are in Vancouver, Burnaby, New Westminster, Richmond, Surrey, Coquitlam and Port Moody.

questions.question_text: The Expo Line travels through which four cities?
questions.explanation: The Expo Line connects Vancouver, Burnaby, New Westminster and Surrey.

questions.question_text: The Millennium Line runs primarily through which areas?
questions.explanation: The Millennium Line goes from East Vancouver through Burnaby to Port Moody and Coquitlam (Tri-Cities).

questions.question_text: The Canada Line primarily serves which two cities?
questions.explanation: The Canada Line connects downtown Vancouver with Richmond (and YVR).

questions.question_text: Waterfront Station is adjacent to which major landmark?
questions.explanation: Waterfront is directly next to Canada Place and the cruise ship terminal on Burrard Inlet.

questions.question_text: The combined Expo and Millennium Lines were once the world's longest driverless system.
questions.explanation: True. At ~79 km, Vancouver was the longest driverless metro until later systems surpassed it.

questions.question_text: SkyTrain appears in several movies/TV shows because of its futuristic appearance.
questions.explanation: True. For example, 'SkyTrackers' from 1986 prominently featured Vancouver's SkyTrain.

questions.question_text: When did SkyTrain revenue service begin?
questions.explanation: December 11, 1985 is the official opening date for SkyTrain service.

questions.question_text: During the 2010 Olympics, SkyTrain operated:
questions.explanation: SkyTrain ran mostly 24/7 during the 2010 Winter Olympics to accommodate spectators (first time doing so).

questions.question_text: Which major extension opened in late 2016?
questions.explanation: The Evergreen Extension (Millennium Line to Coquitlam) opened in December 2016.

questions.question_text: Which project was cancelled in 2018 in favor of extending SkyTrain in Surrey?
questions.explanation: In 2018, the planned Surrey LRT was cancelled, and resources were reallocated to SkyTrain to Langley.

questions.question_text: What portion of pre-pandemic ridership had SkyTrain recovered by mid-2025?
questions.explanation: By Q2 2025, SkyTrain was carrying ~95% of 2019 ridership again.

questions.question_text: Which two stations left the Millennium Line and became Expo Line stations in 2016?
questions.explanation: In 2016, Braid and Sapperton stations switched from Millennium to Expo Line service.

questions.question_text: Which company operates the Canada Line under contract?
questions.explanation: ProTrans BC (an SNC-Lavalin subsidiary) operates the Canada Line under a P3 contract.

questions.question_text: Which SkyTrain station is integrated into a shopping complex in New Westminster?
questions.explanation: New Westminster Station is built into a shopping complex (Shops at New West) at platform level.

questions.question_text: There have never been SkyTrain collisions because of its automatic controls.
questions.explanation: True. Despite rare outages, SkyTrain's moving-block system has prevented train-to-train collisions.

questions.question_text: The 2014 SkyTrain outages led TransLink to offer free transit tickets as compensation.
questions.explanation: True. After two major outages in July 2014, TransLink offered free tickets and commissioned an independent review.

questions.question_text: Which transit project did Metro Vancouver mayors cancel in favor of the Surrey-Langley SkyTrain extension?
questions.explanation: In November 2018, the planned Surrey LRT was cancelled, and a decision was made to build SkyTrain along Fraser Hwy.
